FuncDef:
The telnet server acl command configures the ACL to control the access of clients to the Telnet server.
The undo telnet server acl command cancels the configuration of the ACL. The telnet server acl command configures the ACL to control the access of clients to the Telnet server. The undo telnet server acl command cancels the configuration of the ACL. By default, no ACL is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ACL4 name.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z) and cannot contain only digits.

Specifies the IPv4 ACL number.
ACL number is an integer data type. The basic acl number value ranges from 2000 to 2999, the advanced acl number value ranges from 3000 to 3999.

Specifies the ACL6 name.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z) and cannot contain only digits.

Specifies the IPv6 ACL number.
ACL number is an integer data type. The basic acl number value ranges from 2000 to 2999, the advanced acl number value ranges from 3000 to 3999.

ExtraInfo: When a device functions as a server, you can configure an ACL on the device to control the Telnet clients that log in to the device through Telnet.
